summary: Comprehensive testing of AtlasPM Portfolio Management SaaS completed. Tested backend APIs, frontend UI, one-click demo login functionality, dashboard display, navigation, authentication persistence, and multi-tenant functionality across 3 tenants (techcorp, startupxyz, enterprise).

minor_bugs.issue: Token refresh endpoint expects refresh_token as query parameter instead of request body
minor_bugs.impact: Token refresh functionality not working as expected
minor_bugs.details: Backend code shows it should accept refresh_token in request body, but API expects it as query parameter

api_inconsistencies.issue: Health endpoint returns HTML instead of JSON
api_inconsistencies.impact: Health check returns frontend HTML instead of backend health status
api_inconsistencies.details: Might be routing issue where /health hits frontend instead of backend

design_issues.issue: No visible logout button or user menu found
design_issues.impact: Users cannot easily logout from the application
design_issues.details: Logout functionality not easily accessible in the UI

passed_tests: Login authentication for all 6 demo users across 3 tenants
Admin dashboard data retrieval with proper statistics
System health checks for admin users
Role-based access control (non-admin users properly restricted)
Frontend login page loading and display
Demo users section with 6 one-click login buttons
Dashboard display with proper statistics and user welcome
Navigation between pages (Dashboard, Portfolios, Projects, Users, Reports, Admin)
Multi-tenant functionality (different tenants show different data)
Manual login form functionality with proper form validation
Frontend-backend integration for authentication and dashboard data
action_item_for_E1: Minor fixes needed: 1) Fix token refresh endpoint to accept refresh_token in request body as per backend code, 2) Add visible logout button/user menu to UI, 3) Ensure /health endpoint returns JSON from backend instead of frontend HTML
